text: An SP hedge is neither beneficial or advantageous as its a 0ev bet.  But what it does is reduce the commision you pay overall. That, depending on your PC status or edge size, can be useful. Eg win £102 and lose £100 and it's net zero after the £2 comm, but win £1 and £1 and you're up paying just 4p in comm. It's easy to test or simulate an SP hedge bet, and it's not one size fits all so just do what's best for your own situation.   'nevergreen' is actually just gentle dig at certain people, not a serious hard and fast rule, it's about make people think about the consequences of each bet rather than it being the given that turns a gambler into a "trader".

text: Exactly, and therefore associating the action with the idea of profit. It's redding for most people most of the time. People hijacked a lot of city terminology to give sports trading credabiliy, but somehow hedging became greening? Tbf Betfair call it cash out but it's definately become the general term. But who started it?

text:
But hedging in finance can be different.

If I buy a future and then sell it, the sell isn't a hedge. It's closing a position.

If I buy a call option and then sell a suitable amount of futures, that's a hedge

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc

elements.text:
But hedging in finance can be different.

If I buy a future and then sell it, the sell isn't a hedge. It's closing a position.

If I buy a call option and then sell a suitable amount of futures, that's a hedge

text: All the same imo Jon, it's just the name for a transaction associated with an existing position, rather than one being made in isolation or in anticipation of a further transaction.

elements.text: All the same imo Jon, it's just the name for a transaction associated with an existing position, rather than one being made in isolation or in anticipation of a further transaction.

text:
Not quite imo.

The examples I presented above tend to create open positions that require future management.

For Betfair hedges (or closing out positions), no further actions are required once the hedge has been matched.

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc
